ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: 'Go to Pharaoh - he has overstepped the limits -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Go to the Pharaoh who has become refractory,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and directed him: “Go to Pharaoh, he has rebelled,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: saying, "Go to the Pharaoh. He has transgressed beyond all bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: That “Go to Firaun – he has rebelled.”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Go to Fir`awn; verily, he has transgressed all bounds.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Go to Firon, surely he has become inordinate.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Go to Pharaoh; he has waxed insolent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: (Saying:) Go thou unto Pharaoh - Lo! he hath rebelled -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: [saying], "Go to Pharaoh, he has exceeded all bounds,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Saying:'go thou Unto Fir'awn; verily he hath waxen exorbitant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: [And said,] ‘Go to Pharaoh, for indeed he has rebelled,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Go thou to Pharaoh for he has indeed transgressed all bounds:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Go to Fir'aun (Pharaoh), verily, he has transgressed all bounds (in crimes, sins, polytheism, disbelief, etc.).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: saying 'Go to Pharaoh, he has become exceedingly insolent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [79:17] ‘Go to Pharaoh; he has indeed become rebellious, he has exceeded [all] bounds with his disbelief,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: ((Saying:) Go thou) Moses (unto Pharaoh. Lo! he hath rebelled) he is arrogant and too proud and has refused to believe in Allah
